conclusion: Determine the resultant Ampere force on the equilateral triangular conductor frame with constant voltage applied across points A and B.
The equilateral triangle ABC is made of uniform resistance wires.
The resistance of each side of the triangle is the same, denoted as R.
The resistance between A and B directly (AB) is R.
The resistance between A and B via C (AC + CB) is 2R.
The effective resistance between A and B is 2R/3.
The current through AC and CB is (1/3)I each.
Ampere force on a wire segment is given by F = BIL.
The resultant of forces on AC and CB is (1/3)F.
The total resultant force is F.
The magnitude of the resultant Ampere force on the three resistance wires is F.
